poem:
### Ghost in Uniform

Night stitched with intentions  
bleeds into morning; Vance, shadow-  
breather, masquerading in borrowed blues,  
knock-knock-knocking past thresholds.  
From mansions to memory,  
he traverses walls, law to law-  
less. Their names in his pocket,  
crumbs of a crooked trail—  
echoes breaking the silence of  
unwritten narratives in suburban streetlights.
